analysis:

Targets young, middle-class Chinese consumers comfortable with sexual consumption but seeking romance-coded, aesthetically pleasing products (millennials/Gen Z in relationships). Emphasizes quality and safety (Thailand latex import) to reconcile modern desire with cultural emphasis on health/responsibility.

3) TABOO NAVIGATION: Sexual content is sanitized via euphemistic branding (â€œCatâ€™s Tongueâ€), playful emojis, and domestic, cute staging that reframes condoms as lifestyle gifts; text-heavy badges (360 design, imported latex) shift focus to functionality and quality, defusing explicitness.

4) PLATFORM CONVENTIONS: Uses Xiaohongshu authenticity markersâ€”product close-ups, multiple angles, lifestyle props, and badge-like claimsâ€”mimicking user-review aesthetics. Visuals replicate influencer curation (soft lighting, coordinated color story) to suggest peer recommendation rather than hard advertising.

5) CONSUMER PSYCHOLOGY: Persuasion relies on affective signalingâ€”associating product with romance, novelty, and social-modern identityâ€”combined with trust cues (origin, design features) to reduce purchase anxiety and convert taboo into a fashionable, safe choice.
